page.title: 16WILD LIFE IN ALL STRETTON
page.content: You will find plenty of wild life in and around All Stretton. There are a lot of house martins there as well. There are lots of squirrels and rabbits and rats and mice and hedgehogs. If you are lucky you might see a badger or a fox. Mink have been seen near the streams. If you go to All Stretton you always see sheep on the hills. Some times you find sheep at school. They are often seen wandering on the roads, even on the by-pass. You will also find ponies with their foals on the Long Mynd but there are not as many now as there used to be. There are grass snakes on the hills and some people say there are adders as well. We haven't seen any but we have seen frogs, toads and newts. In the streams there are brown trout and lots of bullheads that we catch.
